title: 【やさしい日本語】ウクライナから 日本(にっぽん)に 逃(に)げてくる 人(ひと)を 助(たす)ける
cleaned_sentences: [★What is it★Easy Japanese] Help people who are coming from Ukraine to Japan.
Russia is now attacking its neighboring country, Ukraine.
Many people have died or fled to other countries.
There are currently around 1,900 Ukrainians in Japan.
There are about 80 people in Fukuoka Prefecture.
The Fukuoka City group, Global Life Support Centre, is engaged in activities to help Ukrainian people.
It helps Ukrainians in Japan to invite their families and acquaintances to Japan.
They will teach you how to enter Japan and help you find a home.
The group has about 100 rooms available for living in Fukuoka and Kitakyushu.
A member of the group said, "We would like to create a system to help and spread it all over the country."
The original article is here Easy Japanese We deliver news translated into "easy Japanese" that is easy for foreigners and children to understand.
